title: Column: China steel exports surge but aluminum shipments slide
summary: China's aluminum production is expected to reach nearly the 45 million ton annual cap, driven by increased domestic demand from manufacturing and energy sectors, leading to a 9.2% drop in refined aluminum exports to 5.59 million tons in the first 11 months. This reduction has boosted global aluminum prices to $2,920 per ton, providing relief to Western smelters facing high energy costs. Steel exports, in contrast, are projected to hit a record high amid low domestic prices.

title: Australia's biggest aluminium smelter gets promise of cheaper renewable power from feds and state
summary: Australia's largest aluminum smelter at Tomago, producing over a third of the country's aluminum (up to 590,000 tonnes annually), has secured government support from federal and NSW governments to address spiraling energy costs that make up 40% of operations. The deal involves underwriting renewable energy projects to keep the smelter running beyond 2028 and protect over 1,000 jobs. This follows similar support packages for other smelters amid energy challenges.

title: Australia Pledges Deal to Keep Giant Rio Tinto Aluminum Smelter Open
summary: Australian federal and state governments have agreed to collaborate with Rio Tinto's Tomago Aluminium, the country's largest smelter producing nearly 40% of Australia's aluminum (up to 590,000 metric tons yearly), to secure affordable power post-2028 and prevent closure due to high energy costs exceeding 40% of operations. The deal includes at least A$1 billion in investments over the next decade. Tomago, operational since 1983, is Australia's biggest electricity user.

title: Tomago Aluminium welcomes continued collaboration on future operations
summary: Tomago Aluminium, a major Rio Tinto joint venture smelter, welcomes ongoing collaboration with Australian governments on future operations to ensure sustainability amid energy cost pressures. The smelter is critical for local manufacturing capability. This aligns with recent government pledges to support its power supply beyond 2028.

title: Aluminum melted with Annular Fresnel solar at over 700°C
summary: Researchers demonstrated an annular Fresnel solar furnace capable of reaching temperatures above 700°C to melt and cast aluminum, showing a practical, low‑cost route for solar-driven aluminum recycling and production of branded ingots during field trials conducted in 2024–2025. The team argues the approach could enable near‑zero‑carbon aluminum recycling at scale in high‑DNI regions such as northern Chile, supporting circular-economy goals and interest from multinationals seeking ‘green aluminum’.

title: CMR seeks aluminum purity in India
summary: CMR Green (formerly Century Metal Recycling) is deploying Steinert sensor-based sorting and XRT technology to improve aluminum alloy purity, raise recovery rates, and reduce emissions for domestic and export markets. The company says better sorting enhances sustainability, workplace safety, and its ability to supply premium recycled aluminum grades to regional and global customers.

title: Metal Scrap Upcycled into High‑Value Alloys with Solid Phase Manufacturing
summary: PNNL researchers report a new solid‑phase alloying method to convert metal scrap into high‑performance aluminum alloys, improving material properties while enabling upcycling of waste into higher‑value products. The approach aims to reduce the environmental footprint of alloy production by avoiding remelting and leveraging solid‑state processing to retain desirable microstructures.

title: Tomago Aluminium welcomes continued collaboration on future operations
summary: Tomago Aluminium and partners confirmed ongoing collaboration regarding the smelter's future operations, reflecting discussions about operational strategy and the site’s long‑term viability amid evolving energy and sustainability considerations. The release underscores stakeholder engagement around the aluminum operation’s future and potential transitions tied to decarbonization pathways.

title: World's first AlN‑based high‑frequency transistor for post‑5G applications
summary: NTT reported the first demonstration of high‑frequency signal amplification using aluminum nitride (AlN)‑based transistors, showing millimeter‑wave power amplification with high Al composition (>75%). While focused on AlN semiconductor technology rather than metallic aluminum, the announcement highlights aluminum‑compound advances relevant to energy‑efficient, high‑frequency electronics and future wireless infrastructure.

title: Panasonic Group to showcase AI driven business solutions and circular‑design recycling advances
summary: Panasonic described BIPV developments and next‑generation recycling infrastructure that enable precise disassembly and high‑purity separation of materials (including metals), aiming to produce high‑quality recycled materials and advance circularity by fiscal 2028. The announcement emphasizes design for maintainability and material recovery that can support sustainable metal (including aluminum) recycling streams.

title: Nippon Steel lifts stainless steel prices for December on higher costs, recovering demand
summary: Nippon Steel announced higher stainless-steel contract prices for December, citing rising alloy costs and signs of recovering local demand; the piece notes the move reflects input-cost pressures and tentative market improvements in the region.[1]  The article indicates the pricing change is part of seasonal/contract adjustments and links it to broader stainless market dynamics and recent industry commentary.[1]

title: Steel Rebounds on Demand Hopes
summary: Rebar futures climbed above CNY 3,080/ton on optimism that an improving macro backdrop and expectations of a US Fed rate cut could support demand, while market participants simultaneously awaited policy signals from China’s Central Economic Work Conference.[2]  The report contrasts the rebound with recent weakness and notes ongoing demand uncertainty in China weighing on sentiment.[2]

title: Global Iron and Steel Prices and News 12.12.2025
summary: Steel Radar's market page compiles the latest prices, indices and short market notes for global iron and steel exchanges, providing snapshot price data (including Shanghai rebar futures) and links to recent price movements and news updates relevant to traders and analysts.[3]  The page is structured as a running market bulletin with dated price lines and short topical items for rebar, scrap and iron markets.[3]

title: Prices for rebar reached local highs at the end of the year
summary: GMK Center reports that rebar prices climbed to local year-end highs, reflecting late-season demand and regional supply factors; the note places recent price moves in the context of seasonal demand and producer behavior.[5]  The item is presented alongside other short market updates and regional production/news briefs in GMK's steel news feed.[5]

title: HRC futures were stable first and then declined today, with the most-traded contract closing at 3,238, down 1.19% for the day
summary: SMM reported that hot-rolled coil (HRC) futures initially held steady but later fell, with the most-traded contract closing down about 1.19%, signaling short-term weakness in finished-steel futures amid fluctuating demand and inventory updates.[7]  The coverage includes contract prices and commentary on market-moving factors for HRC trading that day.[7]

title: This week, social HRC inventory was 2.598 million mt; finished steel prices fluctuated downward
summary: Metal News summarized weekly HRC inventory at about 2.598 million mt and noted finished-steel prices fluctuated downward amid increased blast furnace maintenance plans and reduced hot-metal production, highlighting supply-side factors influencing near-term price pressure.[8]  The brief places the inventory and production developments alongside demand trends to explain recent price volatility.[8]

title: Thyssenkrupp pauses steel production at two sites citing Asian pressure
summary: Europe's largest steelmaker Thyssenkrupp is pausing steel production at its Gelsenkirchen, Germany, and Isbergues, France, sites for about two weeks due to a surge in low-cost Asian imports, leading to underutilized capacity. The French site will also operate at 50% capacity for at least four months starting January. The company calls for swift EU trade protection measures to restore sustainable operations, amid ongoing challenges from high energy costs and competition.

title: Spread between US HRC and imports tightens marginally
summary: The price spread between US hot-rolled coil (HRC) and imported steel has narrowed slightly to $68 per short ton, down $4 from last week, due to 50% Section 232 tariffs making imports more expensive. US HRC remains cheaper than Asian imports by $152/st and Italian imports by $169/st after tariffs and costs. Domestic lead times are shorter, supporting US producers amid reinstated higher tariffs since March 2025.

title: Steel Imports Down 16.7% In September vs. August
summary: US steel imports dropped 16.7% in September compared to August, with year-to-date finished import market share at 19%. The decline reflects ongoing tariff impacts and market dynamics affecting import volumes. This data highlights a continued reduction in reliance on foreign steel supplies.

title: Utility Global and Kyocera Join Forces to Scale H2Gen® Manufacturing Globally for Economic Industrial Decarbonization
summary: Utility Global and Kyocera are partnering to scale production of H2Gen systems, combining Utility's electrochemical cell technology with Kyocera's manufacturing expertise for hydrogen production using industrial off-gases. This enables economic decarbonization in hard-to-abate sectors like steel by producing clean hydrogen without electricity, lowering costs and emissions. The technology targets blast furnace steel production, which accounts for over 70% of global steel output and 85% of industry emissions.

title: Whyalla Steelworks Hydrogen Integration Transforms Australian Green Steel Production
summary: Whyalla Steelworks is integrating hydrogen-based direct reduction iron (DRI) technology to revolutionize green steel production in Australia. This innovation aims to reduce carbon emissions through sustainable steelmaking processes. The development marks a significant step toward low-emission steel manufacturing.

title: Weyerhaeuser and Aymium Enter Agreement to Rapidly Scale Biocarbon Market
summary: Weyerhaeuser and Aymium have partnered to expand biocarbon manufacturing, providing a sustainable alternative for steel production to replace traditional coal-based carbon. This initiative scales production of biocarbon derived from wood residuals, supporting decarbonization in the steel industry. The agreement accelerates the market for low-emission materials in heavy industry.

title: Comex Copper Settles 2.87% Higher at $5.4270 — Data Talk
summary: Front‑month Comex copper for December delivery rose 15.15 cents per pound (2.87%) to $5.4270, marking the largest one‑day dollar gain since Oct. 13, 2025 and the largest one‑day percentage gain since Nov. 10, 2025; the note also highlights multi‑session gains and that the settlement was the highest since July 30, 2025.[1] The piece presents settlement statistics, recent performance versus 52‑week highs/lows, and month‑ and year‑to‑date changes based on Dow Jones Market Data and FactSet.[1]

title: Copper price rally resumes on supply warning
summary: Copper rebound pushed three‑month LME futures toward a near record as warnings of a sizable supply shortfall and mine disruptions supported prices, with LME three‑month futures settling at $11,556.50/ton after an intraday gain; the article cites structural supply concerns and demand drivers such as EVs, data centers and renewable energy boosting the bullish case.[4][6] It also notes a prior record near $11,771/ton and that short‑term moves were influenced by China demand data and the US interest‑rate decision.[4][6]

title: Copper prices drop from record highs; Market awaits Fed policy
summary: Report describes copper slipping from a record high amid market focus on upcoming US Fed policy and economic data, with benchmark three‑month LME copper quoted around $11,450/ton at one point while Shanghai contract moved lower; the report highlights investor attention on US payrolls and unemployment for Fed signals and records moves in other metals like silver and palladium.[2] It frames price dynamics as sensitive to rate expectations and Chinese demand indicators.[2]

title: Copper rises with Fed rate cut, worries about outflows to US stocks
summary: Copper prices rose after a US Federal Reserve rate cut, with buying supported by flows out of US copper stocks and continued concern about supply tightness; the article links the rate decision to the rally and notes movements across related metals.[7] It reports market reaction to monetary policy alongside physical market flows as drivers of price moves.[7]

title: Copper rises to record high on rate cut - Markets
summary: Markets report that copper hit an all‑time high following a US Fed rate cut, with continuing flows into copper stocks cited as supporting the price surge and market commentary emphasizing tight fundamentals and demand from electrification and tech sectors.[8] The short item summarizes the market reaction to monetary policy and flow dynamics underlying the rally.[8]

title: Investors See Copper Market Structural Deficit as Demands Surges
summary: Analysis argues the copper market faces a structural supply deficit as electrification and EV demand grow while new projects underdeliver, projecting prices could need to rise to $20,000–30,000/ton to incentivize new supply; it details supply shortfalls, capital intensity of projects and forecasts for long‑term demand growth.[5] The piece frames current nominal prices (~$11k–12k/ton) as insufficient in real terms and discusses geographic supply prospects (Chile, DRC) and industry investment gaps.[5]

title: Border States Commodity Update — December 2025
summary: Monthly commodity update notes copper opened at about $5.38/lb and highlights ongoing processing fee negotiations between miners and China’s smelters that set global benchmarks, while pointing to ore shortages from mine incidents and low smelter utilization supporting tighter fundamentals.[3] The bulletin summarizes industry dynamics including smelter capacity, processing fees, and broader supply pressures influencing prices.[3]

title: Copper reaches record high on supply concerns ahead of Fed decision
summary: Copper prices hit a record high due to supply concerns, with 2025 production likely dipping below 1 billion metric tons after first ten months output of 817.87 million tons. The article highlights ongoing supply tightness amid global market dynamics. Related notes mention smelter challenges and production impacts.

title: Border States Commodity Update — December 2025
summary: Global copper miners and China's smelters negotiate processing fees amid ore shortages and overcapacity, leading to record-low fees and smelters operating at 75% capacity. Tight supply has forced production cuts worldwide. Copper futures hit record highs in late October due to supply issues and market factors.

title: Capital demands soar for new copper supply
summary: Development costs for copper projects have escalated, with delays in 13 of 22 analyzed projects; Capstone Copper's Santo Domingo saw a 55% capex increase to boost annual output to 68,500 metric tons. Barrick's Reko Diq in Pakistan targets 377,000 metric tons annually from 2028 with high capex. Capital intensity averages high across regions, underscoring supply challenges.

title: Large copper-gold system outlined at Iskut
summary: Latest assay results from 2025 drill program at Iskut reveal a large porphyry copper-gold system. The findings continue to expand the known mineralization at the site. This outlines potential for significant copper production development.

title: Copper price rally resumes on supply warning
summary: Copper price rally resumes amid supply warnings, with the Cobre Mendocino mine expected to produce 40,000 tonnes of copper concentrates annually. Broader market notes highlight record prices on US economic outlook. Supply constraints continue to drive volatility.

title: Rio Tinto's Nuton Technology: A Game-Changer in Low-Carbon Copper Production
summary: Rio Tinto's Nuton bioleaching technology uses microorganisms to extract copper from sulfide ores, eliminating smelting and reducing carbon emissions by 65% and water use significantly. It shortens supply chains and positions the company to capture premiums for green copper, with costs below $2,500 per ton at sites like Utah's Kennecott mine. This innovation supports sustainability amid rising demand for copper in renewables and EVs.

title: Gunnison Copper Announces That Rio Tinto's Nuton Technology ...
summary: Rio Tinto's Nuton technology has produced its first copper at industrial scale in just 18 months, achieving up to 85% recovery from primary sulfides without smelting or refining. It offers up to 80% less water usage and 60% lower carbon emissions than traditional methods, with a U.S.-lowest footprint of 0.82 kg CO₂-e per kg copper at Johnson Camp using 100% renewable energy. The technology extends mine life by processing waste materials.

title: Rio Tinto's Nuton Technology Produces First Copper
summary: Rio Tinto's Nuton has achieved a milestone by producing first copper cathode at Johnson Camp, proving cleaner, faster production at scale with 85% recovery rates from sulfides. It reduces water use by 80% and emissions by 60%, delivering the lowest U.S. carbon footprint of 0.82 kg CO₂-e/kg using renewables. Future phases will validate long-term performance for sustainable supply chains.

title: Nickel - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: Nickel prices fell to 14,602.75 USD/T on December 12, 2025, down 0.05% from the previous day. Over the past month, prices have declined 2.39%, and are down significantly year-over-year. Forecasts indicate prices at 14,909.70 USD/MT by quarter-end.

title: [Nickel Midday Market Review] Nickel Prices Plunge Sharply
summary: SMM #1 refined nickel prices averaged 118,850 yuan/mt on December 11, down 300 yuan/mt from the prior day amid Fed rate cut news overshadowed by weak fundamentals. SHFE nickel futures closed down 0.7% at 116,920 yuan/mt. Short-term prices expected in 114,000-118,000 yuan/mt range.

title: [SMM Nickel Flash] Upstream-Downstream Contradictions Surface as NPI Market Stagnates
summary: On December 12, upstream nickel offers increased but sales remained difficult, with most transactions at average levels. Supply side challenges highlight contradictions between upstream and downstream markets. NPI market shows stagnation.

title: LME nickel prices extend weekly gains, hit 4-week high
summary: LME nickel prices extended weekly gains to a 4-week high, with December average at US$14,692, slightly above November's US$14,670. Current inventory levels remain high despite the price rise.

title: Nickel Industries lifts 2025 nickel sales and receives green light for growth
summary: Nickel Industries received approval to raise its 2025 nickel ore sales quota from 9 million to 10.5 million wet metric tonnes, restarting sales from Hengjaya Mine. A five-year environmental permit supports 2026 growth targeting 19 million wmt annually. This boosts near-term revenue to Indonesia Morowali Industrial Park.

title: Nickel Industries Boosts Nickel-Ore Sales Quota
summary: Nickel Industries boosted its 2025 nickel ore sales quota from 9 to 10.5 million wet metric tonnes from Hengjaya Mine, resuming stockpiled ore sales to Indonesia Morowali Industrial Park. Five-year AMDAL environmental approval underpins 2026 quota expansion. Expected to enhance revenue streams.

title: Nickel Industries lifts 2025 nickel sales and receives green light for growth
summary: Nickel Industries obtained approval to increase its 2025 RKAB (nickel ore sales quota) from 9 million to 10.5 million wet metric tonnes, allowing immediate restart of sales from the Hengjaya Mine and sales into the Indonesia Morowali Industrial Park. The company also secured a five-year AMDAL environmental permit and is seeking a larger 2026 quota while advancing its Excelsior Nickel Cobalt (ENC) HPAL project targeting ~72,000 tpa of nickel metal output when operational.

title: Nickel Industries Boosts Nickel-Ore Sales Quota
summary: ShareCafe reports the Indonesian government approved an increase in Nickel Industries' 2025 nickel‑ore sales quota from 9 million to 10.5 million wet metric tonnes, enabling immediate sale of stockpiled ore and supporting applications for a larger 2026 quota after securing a five‑year AMDAL environmental approval. The article frames the move as revenue‑positive and important for the company's supply commitments into the Indonesian industrial park.

title: Vale Foresees Higher Iron Ore, Copper & Nickel Production Next Year
summary: Industrial Info Resources reports Vale expects to increase nickel volumes by about 12% next year, targeting roughly 170,000–200,000 tonnes, as part of raised production guidance across iron ore, copper and nickel and elevated capital investment plans through 2027. The coverage summarizes Vale's outlook and guidance adjustments for base metals production and related capital spending.

title: Lifezone Metals Advances Kabanga Nickel Project Toward 2026 Final Investment Decision
summary: Lifezone Metals announced progress on the Kabanga Nickel Project after raising US$75 million in H2 2025 to fund pre‑FID activities and execution readiness toward a 2026 final investment decision; the July 2025 feasibility study positions Kabanga as one of the world's largest, highest‑grade development‑ready nickel sulphide deposits with attractive project economics. The release highlights expected low AISC and the company's work with the Tanzanian government to de‑risk and ready the project for full‑scale execution.

title: Nickel Industries: Hengjaya Mine gets higher nickel quota
summary: Petromindo reports that Nickel Industries' Hengjaya Mine received a higher 2025 nickel quota, enabling expanded sales and operations; the article notes timing and local regulatory context for the quota change. Full article access requires login, but the listing confirms the quota increase and local reporting on the company's activities.

title: Nickel Industries lifts 2025 nickel sales and receives green light for growth
summary: Nickel Industries has increased its 2025 nickel ore sales quota to 10.5 million wet metric tonnes and secured a five-year environmental permit enabling innovative in-pit tailings storage and a limonite slurry pipeline for its ENC HPAL plant. This technology aims to position ENC as the lowest carbon and cost-intensive HPAL globally while improving traceability and reducing environmental impact. The company anticipates approval for a 2026 quota of 19 million wmt and focuses on commissioning the Excelsior Nickel Cobalt project for EV battery supply.

title: ZincFive Wins Multiple Categories in the 2025 Power Technology Excellence Awards
summary: ZincFive has won awards in Innovation, Product Launch, Safety, and Environmental Excellence for its nickel-zinc battery technology, which offers high power density, inherent safety, and 25-50% lower lifetime greenhouse gas emissions than lead-acid or lithium-ion alternatives. The technology supports sustainability through recyclable materials and is deployed in nearly 2 gigawatts of systems for AI-driven data centers. This recognition underscores ZincFive's leadership in safe, sustainable power solutions for mission-critical infrastructure.

title: ZincFive Secures $30M in Oversubscribed Series F Financing to Power the Data Center Infrastructure Behind the AI Boom
summary: ZincFive raised $30 million in oversubscribed Series F financing to expand its nickel-zinc battery technology, which provides superior power density, safety, and sustainability for data centers powering the AI boom. The funding supports scaling production of these environmentally friendly batteries as an alternative to traditional chemistries.

title: Tenaris in Italy achieves ASME certification for the supply of materials for the nuclear sector
summary: Tenaris's seamless steel pipe mill in Dalmine, Italy, has obtained ASME III certification, enabling the supply of certified materials for nuclear facilities. This accreditation supports global nuclear projects amid growing investments in low-carbon energy. It ensures compliance with stringent international standards for safety and quality in new plants and maintenance.

title: Tenaris is a worldsteel Sustainability Champion for eighth consecutive year
summary: Tenaris has been recognized as a worldsteel Sustainability Champion for the eighth year, highlighting its leadership in environmental, health, safety, social, governance, and economic practices. Recent investments include a new Consteel® furnace in Argentina, modernization in the US, and upgrades at its Dalmine mill in Italy. The company is advancing toward a 30% emissions intensity reduction by 2030 while expanding renewable energy to 20% usage in 2024.
